page.title: 02GREAT AMWELL WEST--FARMING
page.content: {SQUARE 3612 The{LANDSCAPE}is undulating. There are scattered areas of predominantly deciduous woodland with little undergrowth. The predominant activity is{FARMING}-- this is mainly arable, the chief crop being barley which is grown on the higher land. On the lower lying land, there is enclosed rough grazing for horses on four separate fields. Here lies Amwellbury Farm, which includes a farmhouse, several outhouses & a barn. Fields of barley extend across to the A10 dual-carriageway, which is the major{road TRANSPORT}artery in the square. There is a B-road linking St.Margarets and Ware and minor roads leading to residential areas.
